alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:29PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Tuscaloosa, northern Greene and northwestern Hale Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 229 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Greene, or 11 miles northwest of Eutaw, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eutaw, Moundville, Akron, Union, New West Greene, West Greene, Knoxville, Mantua, Snoddy, Ralph, New Mount Hebron, Moundville Airport, Clinton, Fosters Boat Landing, Mound State Park, Fosters, Elliots Creek, I 20 Rest Area Near Eutaw and Havana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Alabama.
